item.title: Get Dragon Ball Sparking Zero And Kakarot Daima Edition For Just $30 Each In This Black Friday Deal
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Dragon Ball fans have eaten well lately with a feast of games based on the hit manga and anime series, and if you're looking to relive the adventures of Goku and his allies, you can get a great Black Friday deal on two excellent games in the franchise. Amazon has discounted Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Daima Edition to $30 (was $50) for the PS5 version, while the massive fighting game Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero has gotten a 50% discount and is available for $30 on both PS5 and Xbox Series X.

Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero

$30 (was $60)

Dragon Ball: Sparking Zero is the most recent video game release in the franchise, and it's an anime-inspired slugfest with a massive roster of characters pulled from every era of Dragon Ball. Everyone from Goku to Vegeta is included in the game's lineup, and while the combat does have a steep learning curve, once you nail it you'll be throwing out Final Flash and Kamehameha attacks like a pro. The game also looks stunning in action, and if you grew up playing the Dragon Ball Budokai Tenkaichi games, then this will appeal to you as it's a continuation of that series.

  • PS5 -- $30 ($60)
  • Xbox Series X -- $30 ($60)

Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot - Daima Edition

$30 (was $50)

In comparison, Dragon Ball Z: Kakarot is an action-RPG that blends fast-paced fisticuffs with level-grinding. The game also gives you a world to explore as you take part in Goku's greatest battles across the Dragon Ball storyline, and since launch, publisher Bandai Namco has expanded on the game with several story DLC drops inspired by classic OVA series and Dragon Ball Super. The Daima Edition does not include those expansions, but it does come bundled with the two-part Daima DLC, which is based on the Dragon Ball Daima anime series. One thing to note here is that only the first part has been released so far, and Part Two will arrive in early 2026.

More Early Black Friday Deals at Amazon

item.title: An Unexpected Developer Is Behind Some Big Free Switch 2 Updates
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Four notable free Switch 2 updates for big-name Nintendo games--such as Super Mario Odyssey--surprisingly came from outside the company. Instead of an internal developer, Panic Button has confirmed working on the following titles for the new hybrid console: Super Mario Bros. U Deluxe, Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury, and Arms.

On X, Panic Button revealed its involvement on the free Switch 2 updates. "Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games," the Austin-based developer stated on social media. The improvements included HDR support for Arms, Super Mario Odyssey, and Bowser's Fury. In addition, GameShare support was added to Super Mario Odyssey and Super Mario 3D World + Bowser's Fury.

Panic Button was honored to be selected by Nintendo to help update marquee games from the Nintendo Switchâ„¢ library. Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games. pic.twitter.com/5P96V9DFUq

â€” Panic Button (Official) (@PanicButtonGame) November 19, 2025

For those unfamiliar, Panic Button has a well-regarded history of bringing games to Switch platforms. For instance, the team was behind Doom and Doom Eternal for the original Switch. Panic Button assisted on porting Warframe to Switch as well. Most recently, the developer worked on Forza Horizon 5 for PS5--marking the first time the racing franchise has appeared on a PlayStation platform.

In other Nintendo-development news, the company actually acquired Shiver Entertainment--a studio known for porting games like Hogwarts Legacy to Switch--last year. Shiver reportedly assisted in bringing WWE 2K25 to Switch 2. Meanwhile, Panic Button is a private company. Speaking of ports, Switch and Switch 2 just saw the surprise release of Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition earlier this week.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/an-unexpected-developer-is-behind-some-big-free-switch-2-updates/1100-6536382/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Kill Bill's The Bride Rides Into Fortnite In Chapter 7 Teaser
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

While Fortnite is currently in the midst of a Springfieldian takeover by The Simpsons, the next chapter of the battle royale's overarching story will soon be upon us. Epic Games has ramped up the teases for what's to come, including a short trailer featuring a certain yellow-clad bride bent on revenge.

The trailer shows many of the main collaborations from Chapter 6--Godzilla, Homer Simpson, and the Megazord among them--before The Bride from Kill Bill speeds into the scene to save Jonesy from danger. The teaser then confirms the end-of-Chapter-6 event will take place November 29 at 11 AM PT / 2 PM ET.

Last night, Fortnite took over the Vista Theater in Hollywood, California for a massive Chapter 7 kickoff event for media and influencers that featured even more hints. Logos on decorations around the theater seem to confirm Chapter 7 Season 1's name as Pacific Break, while the DeLorean from Back to the Future also appeared in the theater itself.

One particularly interesting tidbit involves a poster for Yuki's Revenge, which appeared on official Fortnite social media accounts. Yuki's Revenge was meant to be a chapter of Kill Bill Volume 1, but it was removed from the final cut before the film released.

Among those spotted at the Vista included Kill Bill director Quentin Tarantino and star Uma Thurman, and KPop Demon Hunters star Rei Ami--which could lend credence to rumors of more KPop Demon Hunters content coming to the game soon.

Since the event, leaker ShiinaBR on X has reported multiple new details about the upcoming season, including hot-air balloons, the ability to drive Reboot Vans, and a Marty McFly skin.

LEAKED CHAPTER 7 INFO FROM CREATOR EVENT ðŸ’€
- Hot air balloons
- Driveable Reboot Vans
- Solo VS Bots mode
- Rift A Palooza events that spawn rifts
- Gameplay UI update
- Battle Pass has Marty McFly and The Bride pic.twitter.com/l9lBrLZMIz

â€” Shiina (@ShiinaBR) November 20, 2025

Fortnite is available now as a free download on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Nintendo Switch 2, PC, and mobile devices.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Battlefield 6's First-Month Sales Were Higher Than Any Game Since 2022 In The US
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Battlefield 6 launched on October 10 and didn't need much time to become 2025's best-selling game overall in the US based on dollar sales. Circana released its latest monthly report today, confirming that Battlefield 6 was October 2025's No. 1 best-selling game and, after just three weeks on sale, became the No. 1 best-selling game of 2025 for physical and digital sales.

Battlefield 6 is also the No. 1 best-selling game on the Xbox and PC charts for 2025, while it ranks No. 2 for 2025 on PlayStation (second only to NBA 2K26).

EA's new Battlefield game also became the best-selling game in Battlefield franchise history in the US for its first month. 2018's Battlefield 1 was the previous record-holder, and in fact, the first-month sales volume for Battlefield 6 has surpassed the lifetime sales of Battlefield 1.

Outside of the Battlefield franchise, Circana confirmed that Battlefield 6 had the highest one-month US and physical full-game dollar sales for any game in the past three years. Not since 2022's Call of Duty: Modern Warfare II did any game generate more first-month physical and digital full-game dollar sales. This would seem to mean that the first-month sales of Battlefield 6 were higher than 2024's Black Ops 6, 2023's Modern Warfare III, and every other game since 2022, except Modern Warfare II.

A key point to consider in this comparison is that Black Ops 6 was the first game to launch into Xbox Game Pass--this was apparently massively negative for direct sales of the game. Black Ops 7 launched on November 14, and in a break from tradition, Activision's celebratory first-weekend post did not include any data about how the game is performing compared to past games. Before this, Activision acknowledged "fatigue" around the Black Ops brand given the back-to-back releases of Black Ops 7 in 2024 and Black Ops 7 in 2025.

A significant caveat to be aware of here is that Nintendo does not participate in Circana's tracking. Circana previously announced that Pokemon Legends: Z-A had the biggest physical game launch in years in the US.

So far, EA has only confirmed that Battlefield 6 sold 7 million copies out of the gate. An industry analyst said that figure later grew to 10 million, though EA has not confirmed this.

Many are wondering if Battlefield 6 is selling well enough to beat Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 this year. That remains to be seen, and many will be looking to Circana's November report coming in December for more information. Keep checking back with GameSpot for the latest.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/battlefield-6s-first-month-sales-were-higher-than-any-game-since-2022-in-the-us/1100-6536380/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac Is Just $20 For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Pac-Man is an enduring icon of the 2D era of gaming, but over the decades, Bandai Namco's mascot has made a few forays into 3D. If you're curious to see just how well Pac-Man translates into the the third dimension, then you can score a discount on Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac as part of a Black Friday deal. A remake of the classic 3D platformer that first launched for PS2, GameCube, and Xbox in 2002, it's on sale for just $20 (was $30) on PS5, Xbox Series X, Switch 2, and Switch.

Pac-Man World 2 Re-Pac

$20 (was $30)

These physical copies of the game include reversible cover art sleeves, allowing you to choose between the new Re-Pac artwork and a recreation of the original 2002 cover art. As you'd expect for a game that hasn't been in the spotlight for more than two decades, there have been quite a few enhancements added to this version of Pac-Man World 2.

Not only has the audio and graphical quality of the game been substantially updated, but quality-of-life changes have also smoothed many of the rough edges from the original game. Additionally, this version offers updated boss battles, a two-player mode for some co-op fun, voice acting, and several levels have been expanded.

  • PS5
  • Xbox Series X
  • Switch 2
  • Switch

Taking place after the mischievous ghosts Blinky, Pinky, Inky, and Clyde steal the golden fruit from Pac-Village--and accidentally unleash the all-powerful ghost Spooky--Pac-Man World 2 sees the hero journey to stop the spooks from taking over the globe. Playing like a Saturday morning cartoon adventure, Pac-Man would explore a wide variety of stages full of enemies and hazards, using his skills to triumph.

item.title: Digimon Time Stranger Gets First Discount For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon's Black Friday deals continue to roll in, including great deals recently released video games like Digimon Story: Time Stranger. The new entry in the long-running Digimon Story RPG series has been well-received so far, and if you haven't checked it out yet, you can grab the standard edition for just $50 (was $70) on both PS5 and Xbox Series X, or if you feel like spoiling yourself, the Ultimate Edition has been discounted to $90 (was $120). These are limited-time deals, so grab them before the sale ends--or the game sells out.

Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition

$90 (was $120)

Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition lives up to its name. It includes the base game, a Digimon collectible trading card, and additional bonus DLC. Here's everything included in this version:

  • Digimon Story: Time Stranger base game
  • Exclusive Digimon TCG card
  • Ultimate Edition game case with unique cover art
  • Special Agumon and Gabumon early unlocks
  • Deluxe Edition Costume Pack (12 Costumes - 3 per character + 3 Side Missions)
  • Cyber Sleuth Costume Set
  • Digimon Story: Time Stranger Season Pass with:
    • 15 additional Digimon
    • Three additional story episodes
    • Golden Moai Bonus Farm Item
    • Public Safety Suit Bonus Costume
    • Special Supplies Set
    • Cyber Sleuth BGM Pack

Amazon's deal applies to both the physical PS5 and Xbox Series X versions of Digimon Story: Time Stranger Ultimate Edition.

Like several other Digimon games, Digimon Story: Time Stranger sees players once again journey across the human world and Digital World to collect Digimon and fight in turn-based battles. The game also focuses on the bond between humans and their Digimon, and Time Stranger improved on the traditional turn-based combat systems for this new release. When you're not battling, you can also live your best digi-life by building a home and running a Digi-shop, which in turn opens the door to more questing opportunities.

"Digimon Story: Time Stranger is a strong argument that it's high time to give the digital monsters their own space in the critter-catching genre. Strong voice acting and mature themes digivolve this time-traveling tale into an emotionally-rewarding journey of grief and self-acceptance, and a vast array of branching options keeps team-building and the turn-based combat exciting," Jordan RamÃ©e wrote in GameSpot's Digimon Story: Time Stranger review.
